Posted By: Gwafa_Hazid (1/29/2010 4:17:55 PM)

posts.post_content:
Well... it's not bad ... it actually allows [Auriok Glaivemaster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Auriok Glaivemaster) and [Kitesail Apprentice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kitesail Apprentice) to survive [Staggershock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Staggershock), although sacrificing 1 point of power compared to [Bonesplitter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bonesplitter) in order to do so.  
  
[Bonesplitter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bonesplitter) is better than Scimitar when dealing with regular creature decks, however the Scimitar might actually be the better choice when dealing with things like [Disfigure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Disfigure) and burn spells.  
  
My final verdict is that this card is under-appreciated. If you're playing some form of aggressive mono white equipment deck with [Kor Duelist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kor Duelist), [Kitesail Apprentice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kitesail Apprentice), [Auriok Glaivemaster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Auriok Glaivemaster) and perhaps [Armament Master](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armament Master), the Scimitar can actually be quite useful, even alongside [Bonesplitter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bonesplitter).  
  
3.5/5
posts.html:
Well... it's not bad ... it actually allows Auriok Glaivemaster and Kitesail Apprentice to survive Staggershock, although sacrificing 1 point of power compared to Bonesplitter in order to do so.

Bonesplitter is better than Scimitar when dealing with regular creature decks, however the Scimitar might actually be the better choice when dealing with things like Disfigure and burn spells.

My final verdict is that this card is under-appreciated. If you're playing some form of aggressive mono white equipment deck with Kor Duelist, Kitesail Apprentice, Auriok Glaivemaster and perhaps Armament Master, the Scimitar can actually be quite useful, even alongside Bonesplitter.

3.5/5
